column1: Q: What's the definition of a Soviet optimist? A: It's a citizen who thinks our future will be as good as our past.
Q: What's the abbreviation of USSR? A: Unfortunately Soups, Sausages, and Rolls are Still Rare.
Q: What is the most reliable Soviet machine? A: The propaganda machine.
Q: Why do Soviet secrets always leak? A: Because in the Soviet Union even the walls have ears.
Q: What's the difference between a Soviet optimist and pessimist? A: A pessimist reads the newspaper and sighs. An optimist reads it and exclaims, "it could have been much worse!"
